Option E doesn’t work because of the consecutive topics and the order of S, G, and J.
full_output:

J must be earlier than G, and G must be earlier than R.  Let’s analyze the options to see if they fit the conditions. Option A doesn’t work because of the consecutive topics and the order of G, R, and J. Option B doesn’t work because of the consecutive topics and the order of J, Q, and G. <ans>E</ans>

D) screen 1: romance at 7 P.M., mystery at 9 P.M. screen 2: western at 7 P.M., horror film at 9 P.M. screen 3: sci-fi film at 8 P.M.
E) screen 1: western at 7 P.M., mystery at 9 P.M. screen 2: sci-fi film at 7 P.M., romance at 9 P.M. screen 3: horror film at 8 P.M.
chain_of_thought: The western must be shown before the horror film, the sci-fi film isn’t shown on screen 3, the romance isn’t shown on screen 2, and the horror and mystery are shown on different screens.  We can deduce the schedule by observing the conditions.
full_output:

<ans>C</ans>
